intro: Crataegus arta, commonly known as the Armenian hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Caucasus region. It typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and features thorny branches with opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in early spring, followed by red berries in the autumn. It is often found in rocky or mountainous areas and is adapted to temperate climates. The bark is smooth and grayish, with a distinctive flaky texture.
